title: Day Braddie is caught stealing anti-ageing products worth $1000 from Mecca Maxima and Sephora
text:
A young mother has been caught stealing anti-aging products worth more than $1000 from high-end cosmetic stores.

Eliza Alexandra Day Braddie, 25, was found with numerous cosmetic products, including face-lifting creams and eye creams, in her handbag when confronted by police in September.

The luxury items had been stolen from stores such as Mecca Maxima and Sephora, with some worth more than $300 each.

At the time, she told police she hadn't kept the receipts.

Eliza Alexandra Day Braddie (pictured) has been caught stealing beauty products worth more than $1000 from high-end cosmetic stores

Police found numerous cosmetic products in the woman's handbag stolen from stores such as Mecca Maxima (stock image pictured) and Sephora, with some worth up to $500 each

The Sunshine Coast woman pleaded guilty in the Maroochydore Magistrates Court on Friday to stealing charges and the possession of a restricted drug which she had claimed was for a 'sore tooth'.

The court heard that she had previously served jail time for taking part in a burglary where she stole possessions worth $1000.

She was also charged with stealing clothes from Target earlier this year, The Sunshine Coast Daily reported.

Defence lawyer Sam O'Connor gave details of Day Braddie's battle with drug addiction.

Magistrate Haydn Stjernqvist said Day Braddie's criminal history appeared to be linked to her drug use and told her she had not tried hard enough to stay clean.

Defence lawyer Sam O'Connor gave details of Day Braddie's drug addiction at Maroochydore Magistrates Court (pictured)

'You've been given every conceivable option to not end up in there (jail).'

After serving 22 days of her nine month jail sentence, Day Braddie is to be released on parole.

In addition to the sentence, the young woman was fined $600.
description: A Sunshine Coast woman has been caught stealing beauty products worth more than $1000 from high-end cosmetic stores.
authors: Mahnaz Angury For Daily Mail Australia
